description: September 14, 2020: With Bulletin N. 262, the Italian Ministry of Health announced that the Italian Minister of Health, Roberto Speranza, has attended the 70th session of the WHO Regional Committee for Europe (RC70), organised by the WHO Regional Office for Europe, on September 14 and 15, 2020. Representatives of 53 countries in the WHO European Region have attended. Representatives of WHO partners such as United Nations agencies and other intergovernmental organisations and regional networks, were also present. Non-State actors (NSAs) in official relations with WHO and regional NSAs accredited by the Regional Committee, have followed the webstream and had the opportunity to submit video and written statements in advance. The key health issues and future plans have been discussed, particularly on themes regarding the response to the COVID-19 pandemic and lessons learned from the pandemic, both globally and regionally.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: Cooperation among different jurisdictional entities (e.g. treaties or agreements among countries or provinces)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: March 11, 2020: With Bulletin N. 107, the Italian Ministry of Health announced that the Italian Minister of Health participated in a meeting with Health Ministers of other European countries including Austria, Denmark, France, Germany, The Netherlands, Poland, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland and UK. During the conference call, each State provided an update on the local epidemiological situation and outlined the measures adopted to fight the COVID-19 emergency.

description:
Poland
July 27th 2021
"Counteracting the aggression of anti-vaccination movements

There was a struggle in front of one of the vaccination points in Grodzisk Mazowiecki. A group of people from an anti-vaccine organization tried to invade the facility, but were stopped by security guards. There were blows. - Actions of this type that took place in Grodzisk Mazowiecki are really unacceptable. This is aggression that should be condemned by all means and we express here our strong words of opposition to such actions - said Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki. Counteracting the aggression of anti-vaccine movements was discussed at a meeting of the Medical Council. "
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Poland is closing schools and universities for two weeks from thursday the 12th of March to the 15th of March. Speaking at a joint conference following a special meeting on coronavirus, the ministers said that pre-schools and schools would stop teaching on Thursday, but limited care would still be provided this week to the youngest children.

description:
Poland
March 12th 2020
Two week break from Physical meetings....
"
Remote classes and home learning

Teachers and university lecturers can send their pupils and students materials to work from home. All this so that the coronavirus does not affect the implementation of educational programs.

Schools

A break in the functioning of the school does not mean days off from school. Read your favorite book, fill in your knowledge or develop your competences. Use the free epodreczniki.pl platform and materials recommended by your teacher.
More information: https://epodreczniki.pl/  

Colleges

Classes at universities can be carried out remotely. In addition, scientists, doctoral students or prospective doctoral students may conduct research activities. Suspension of classes does not limit the conduct of research.
Students and academic teachers will also be able to use the Navoica e-learning platform"
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland is closing all schools and universities for two weeks. Speaking at a joint conference following a special meeting on coronavirus, the ministers said that pre-schools and schools would stop teaching on Thursday the 12th of March, but limited care would still be provided this week to the youngest children.
Update: From the 6th of May, kindergartens may reopen. Other schools and universities remain closed. UPDATE: The Polish Ministry of Education has announced that from May 4th creches and kindergartens may reopen.

March 12th 2020
Two week break from Physical meetings....
"
Remote classes and home learning

Teachers and university lecturers can send their pupils and students materials to work from home. All this so that the coronavirus does not affect the implementation of educational programs.

Schools

description:
Poland
March 12th 2020
Two week break from Physical meetings....
"
Remote classes and home learning

Teachers and university lecturers can send their pupils and students materials to work from home. All this so that the coronavirus does not affect the implementation of educational programs.

Schools

A break in the functioning of the school does not mean days off from school. Read your favorite book, fill in your knowledge or develop your competences. Use the free epodreczniki.pl platform and materials recommended by your teacher.
More information: https://epodreczniki.pl/  

Colleges

Classes at universities can be carried out remotely. In addition, scientists, doctoral students or prospective doctoral students may conduct research activities. Suspension of classes does not limit the conduct of research.
Students and academic teachers will also be able to use the Navoica e-learning platform" UPDATE: Whereas restaurants were closed for take-away only and hair dressers/ beauty salons were closed.
Starting May 18th 2020, and as part of the 3rd stage of reopening, these places may reopen following strict health guidelines.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
institution_status: Primary Schools closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Education,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Poland
August 14th 2021
Following the recent reopening of schools the education minister announced that going forward it is safe for all schools to conduct sessions with exception of those in red areas. Those in red areas may face further restrictions.

As well, the minister set the responsibility of healthcare response onto city and school officials.

description:
Poland
September 1st 2020
"According to the guidelines prepared by the ministries of health and education, together with the chief sanitary inspector, a student without symptoms of respiratory tract infection and when the household members are not in quarantine or isolation can attend school.

General rules of hygiene apply in schools: frequent hand washing (immediately upon arrival at school), protection when sneezing and coughing, and avoiding touching eyes, nose and mouth. People entering the school building should be able to use hand sanitizer. If it is possible, in the cloakroom every other box should be made available to students or different hours of coming to school should be introduced.

As far as possible, work is to be organized in such a way as to keep the distance between people staying at school and limit the gathering of students. Students and teachers in classrooms do not have to wear masks covering their mouth and nose. "
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
institution_status: Preschool or childcare facilities allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Number of people on the school premises are limited (e.g. only 50 people allowed on school premises),School event cancelled or postponed,Temperature Check,Special provisions exist for how teaching is done which applies to all teachers,Special provisions for all students in a school (e.g. students in primary school do not have to social distance)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description:
Poland
August 23rd 2021

"Safety measures will be provided to schools and kindergartens, including gloves, masks and thermometers

We make every effort to ensure that the return of children and adolescents to school is safe . That is why MEiN together with RARS will transfer safety measures to schools and kindergartens. Disinfection stations with the function of measuring temperature in front of the building will be installed in schools. RARS will take care of the purchase and distribution of the equipment. In addition, all schools and kindergartens will receive personal protective equipment: gloves, masks, disinfectant liquid and thermometers. "

description:
Poland
December 2nd 2020
"Contracts for the purchase of vaccines have been signed

The health and safety of citizens is our priority. The Polish government has signed contracts for the purchase of the COVID-19 vaccine with three companies:

    Pfizer BioNtech;
    Johnson&Johnson;
    AstraZeneca.

After approval by European institutions, over 45 million doses of the COVID-19 vaccine will be sent to our country.

The vaccination process against COVID-19 is the largest logistic operation related to the health of Poles. Work is currently underway on the Government Vaccination Strategy, which will be adopted by the Council of Ministers after consultations in mid-December. "
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
type_vac_cat: Covishield (Indian-made version of AstraZeneca Serum Institute India)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Poland
December 22nd 2020
"As part of the first delivery, Poland will receive nearly 10,000. doses of COVID-19 vaccines. 18 hospitals will receive from 150 to 900 doses, others, selected for vaccination in the first round, hospitals - 75 doses each. The first delivery will reach the country on December 26.

- By the end of December, another 300,000 will be delivered to Poland. vaccines, and then by the end of January we will have a total of 1.5 million vaccines - which will allow approx. 750,000 to be acquired by the end of January. patients - the head of the Chancellery of the Prime Minister, Michał Dworczyk, informed during a conference in the hospital. "

description:
Poland
March 13th 2020
"Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki announced on Friday, March 13, that all foreign nationals will be barred from entering Poland for ten days from Sunday, March 15, to limit the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19). All Polish citizens and residents will be allowed to return to the country but will be required to undergo a 14-day quarantine. All international inbound flights and trains will be suspended from 00:00 (local time) on Sunday, with the exception of some charter flights transporting returning Poles."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)

description:
Poland
March 13th 2020
"Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki announced on Friday, March 13, that all foreign nationals will be barred from entering Poland for ten days from Sunday, March 15, to limit the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19). All Polish citizens and residents will be allowed to return to the country but will be required to undergo a 14-day quarantine. All international inbound flights and trains will be suspended from 00:00 (local time) on Sunday, with the exception of some charter flights transporting returning Poles." UPDATE: The international flight ban will be extended until at least December 31st 2020 with some exceptions....
"However, citizens and residents of EEA member states, as well as those of Australia, Canada, Georgia, Japan, New Zealand, South Korea, Switzerland, Thailand, and Tunisia, are permitted to enter without restriction. Persons entering Poland from elsewhere, as well as individuals who have been close to people infected with COVID-19 or who live with a person who is self-isolating, must self-isolate for 10 days on arrival."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: All countries
target_who_what: All Foreign Nationals (Foreign Residents + Foreign Travelers)

description:
Poland
March 13th 2020
"Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki announced on Friday, March 13, that all foreign nationals will be barred from entering Poland for ten days from Sunday, March 15, to limit the spread of coronavirus (COVID-19). All Polish citizens and residents will be allowed to return to the country but will be required to undergo a 14-day quarantine. All international inbound flights and trains will be suspended from 00:00 (local time) on Sunday, with the exception of some charter flights transporting returning Poles." UPDATE: On January 15th 2021 the policy was again extended and some clarifications were given....

"Entry restrictions for most foreign nationals remain in place, except for the following:

    Spouses, children, or dependents of Polish or EEA citizens.

    Foreigners who hold a Polish identity card (Karta Polaka).

    Foreigners who are permanent or temporary residents of Poland.

    Students enrolled in Polish educational institutions.

    Scientists who are conducting research or developmental work in Poland.

    Foreigners with valid work visas."

description:
Poland
March 29th 2021
New quarantine policies are put into place for those coming into Poland...

"Rules for travelers coming to Poland from the Schengen area

    Travelers will be quarantined unless they test negative for COVID-19. The test will have to be performed no later than 48 hours before the border is crossed.
    Test type: PCR or antigenic.
    The new rules will apply to all means of transport: collective and individual transport as well as crossing the border on foot.
    Travelers who have been quarantined in Poland will be able to take a test, the negative result of which will release them from quarantine.

Rules for travelers coming to Poland from outside the Schengen area

    Each traveler will be placed in quarantine.
    A test performed in the country of origin of the person will not be released from quarantine.
    Travelers who have been quarantined may take a test in Poland, the negative result of which will release them from quarantine.
    Test type: PCR or antigenic."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
enforcer: National Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Poland
November 29th 2021

"Extended quarantine for travelers from non-Schengen countries

From December 1 to December 17, 2021, we are also introducing changes to the quarantine rules for travelers from non-Schengen countries. What will change?

We extend the quarantine to 14 days. Early release from quarantine will be possible in the case of a negative result of the PCR test, which was performed after 8 days from the date of crossing the border. Quarantine does not apply to fully vaccinated people who have the EU digital COVID certification. "
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Poland
May 25th 2021
"Those who do not possess a negative test will be required to self-isolate for 10 days upon arrival, as will all travelers arriving from outside the Schengen Area. Travelers may end their quarantine by providing a negative COVID-19 test taken within 48 hours after arrival except for travelers from Brazil, India, and South Africa who can test out of self-isolation no sooner than seven days after arrival. Travelers who have been issued a certificate of vaccination indicating inoculation with a European Union-approved vaccine or who can prove they have recovered from COVID-19 in the previous six months are exempt from quarantine. " UPDATE: As of December 17th 2021, the policy for non-schengan countries was updated... "As of Dec. 17, all travelers above the age of 12 years arriving from non-Schengen countries must present a negative PCR or antigen test result taken no more than 24 hours before arrival, regardless of vaccination status; the result must be in English or Polish. Arrivals without such a result must self-isolate for 14 days; travelers may end the quarantine period on day eight by providing a negative PCR test result. Authorities have advised that travelers will be able to test at some Polish airports before the border passport control.

International Entry Restrictions
All travelers arriving from the EU, Schengen Area, or Turkey must present either proof of vaccination or recovery, or a negative PCR or rapid antigen test result dated no more than 48 hours before arrival. Travelers arriving without any of these documents must self-isolate for 10 days upon arrival.

All travelers arriving from outside of the Schengen Area who do not possess an EU digital COVID vaccine certification or a vaccination certificate from the UK must self-isolate for 14 days upon arrival. Travelers may end the quarantine period on day eight by providing a negative PCR test. "
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: All countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Poland
April 20th 2020
Contact Tracing
"Poland’s ProteGO Safe app comprises two modules. The first is an electronic journal for users to monitor the state of their health. The second uses Bluetooth technology to record data on proximity to other users with the app installed on their devices.

If a user contracts COVID-19, they should report the infection in the app using a special PIN, resulting in other users who have spent some time in the same places as them within the last 14 days being informed.

The first version of the Polish app was released on 20 April. The launch of its full, improved version including tracing technology followed on 9 June. As the government website promoting the app stresses, it is “important for as many people as possible to use it”."
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: A person’s absolute (e.g. GPS) location over time
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

"Poland’s ProteGO Safe app comprises two modules. The first is an electronic journal for users to monitor the state of their health. The second uses Bluetooth technology to record data on proximity to other users with the app installed on their devices.

If a user contracts COVID-19, they should report the infection in the app using a special PIN, resulting in other users who have spent some time in the same places as them within the last 14 days being informed.

The first version of the Polish app was released on 20 April. The launch of its full, improved version including tracing technology followed on 9 June. As the government website promoting the app stresses, it is “important for as many people as possible to use it”." UPDATE: The policy actually had more to it than simply changing in June 9th 2020. The june 9th update added GPS and was not in the original policy
type_sub_cat: A person’s absolute (e.g. GPS) location over time
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
April 2020
Contact Tracing
"The Polish government released the initial version of its ProteGO app in April. The app used a centralised model, in which some data are uploaded to a server for processing and storage when a person marks themselves as Covid-19 positive in the app. This model, which is also being used by France and the UK, has attracted criticism from lawmakers, academics and activists due to its privacy implications." UPDATE: The policy was updated on June 9th 2020 facing privacy concerns and decentralized the data collection process.
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: A person’s absolute (e.g. GPS) location over time
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
April 1st 2020
"The Minister of Health, bearing in mind the epidemiological situation in Poland, informs that from April 2, 2020 until further notice, using the powers granted by the Act of March 2, 2020 on special solutions related to the prevention, counteracting and combating COVID-19, other infectious diseases and
crisis situations caused by them (Journal of Laws, item 374, as amended), introduces rationing of the drugs Arechin (Chloroquinum) and Plaquenil (Hydroxychloroquinum).

Considering that the above drugs may prove useful in combating COVID-19, they should go primarily to hospitals that conduct the treatment of patients with this disease. As a result of the epidemic situation, these drugs will not be available in the current amount in retail trade in pharmacies for patients, but will be available only on the following terms. "
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

"Thanks to the new equipment, we will be able to perform even more tests, and thus serve the inhabitants of not only Gdynia, but also the entire Pomerania region even better - assessed prof. Marcin Renke, director of the University Center.

The hospital in Gdynia has acquired a second specialist computed tomography device. The new equipment will be used mainly in the diagnosis of Covid-19, but also in the treatment of other diseases. The tomograph is also safe in pediatric examinations. This is especially important especially in the face of the current epidemic, which has affected the availability of benefits. "

description:
Poland
September 5th 2020

New guidelines for Hospitals...
"
    in all hospitals belonging to the hospital network will create places for patients with suspected coronavirus Patients will remain in the facility until the test result is received or, if necessary, life-saving procedures are implemented.
    In infectious diseases hospitals will secure places for the treatment of people infected with coronavirus. It will be 87 infectious and observation-infectious wards, which we will prepare to admit patients with COVID-19. In total, there are about 4 thousand. places for patients requiring typical internal medicine care, but also e.g. connection to a ventilator.
    Patients already diagnosed with coronavirus will also be referred to multi-specialist hospitals . People who require highly specialized treatment will be sent to these centers. However, it will also be possible to provide benefits to people who are not infected with the coronavirus. In these hospitals, we will prepare over 2,000. places."
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
October 8th 2020
"Hospital security is our priority in the fight against the coronavirus. We observe, analyze and react on an ongoing basis.

Therefore, we are increasing the number of beds for COVID-19 patients. A coordination hospital will be established in each voivodeship, with additional intensive care stations for patients infected with coronavirus.

The Coordination Hospital will act as the main hospital in a given voivodeship. Importantly, it will be focused on caring for a patient with COVID-19. The directors of these institutions will be included in the voivodeship crisis management teams, which will coordinate:

    patient flow between hospitals in consultation with doctors from other hospitals, primary care physicians and outpatient specialist care physicians,
    movement of "swab" and transport ambulances,
    transfer of patients to isolatories.

Thanks to the increase in the number of hospitals, the number of available beds will increase to 13.5 thousand. "
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
October 19th 2020
"Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki ordered the preparation of plans to build temporary hospitals in each voivodeship city. In the first place, they will be created in the Mazowieckie, Małopolskie and Wielkopolskie voivodships.

The first temporary hospital for patients with COVID-19 will be located at the National Stadium in Warsaw.

Increasing the number of beds in poviat and voivodeship hospitals

The government wants some poviat hospitals to deal only with the treatment of COVID-19 patients. This means that if there are two poviat hospitals in the region close to each other, one of them will take over patients with coronavirus from both poviats, while the other will take care of the remaining patients. Thanks to this solution, 10 thousand. beds for COVID-19 patients.

The changes will also apply to provincial hospitals. Some of the internal medicine departments in such hospitals will be transformed (in whole or in a significant percentage) for the purposes of combating COVID-19. As a result of this operation, approx. 3 thousand. beds for coronavirus patients. "

"a list of private hospitals with beds for COVID-19 patients will be developed in cooperation with private clinics."

"exempt resident doctors from the oral examination. In addition, medical personnel involved in the fight against COVID-19 will receive an allowance of 100%. basic salary."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
March 22nd 2020

The government creates criteria for testing...

"Clinical criteria

Every person it happened to

Group A. Criteria that additionally require meeting the epidemiological criterion.

One or more of the following symptoms of an acute respiratory infection:

- fever

- cough

- shortness of breath

Group B. Criteria that do not require meeting the epidemiological criterion

– a hospitalized person with symptoms of a severe respiratory infection without finding any other etiology fully explaining the clinical picture

LUB

– a person in a life or health emergency with symptoms of respiratory failure "

description:
Poland
October 10th 2020

"From now on, after a patient tests positive, he/she is to return to a family doctor or a first-level hospital. Patients who are asymptomatic or show only very mild symptoms will be allowed to self-isolate at home. If the symptoms are visible, the doctor will decide whether to refer the patient to an infectious disease hospital or a third level hospital. 

- Doctors will decide whether a given patient should be diagnosed only by means of a phone interview or whether the condition and situation require an in-person visit and thus also a physical examination - said the Minister."

description:
Poland
November 3rd 2020

"The pulse oximeter will monitor your health at home

A pulse oximeter is a small electronic device. It is used for the non-invasive measurement of blood saturation. Soon, it will support medical services in monitoring the health of COVID-19 patients who have mild disease and have been qualified for medical home care. The data sent by the device will be analyzed by a special monitoring center. It will be a new unit to be established by the Ministry of Health. "

description:
Poland
March 24th 2020
"On Tuesday, March 24, Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki announced a series of new domestic restrictions intended to curb the spread of coronavirus disease (COVID-19). As of Tuesday, individuals in Poland will be prohibited from leaving their homes except for essential activities."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Poland is introducing a general lock-down: until April 11 inclusive, people will not be able to move freely outside their living, health and professional goals.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: On March 24th the Polish government stated that starting March 25th 2020 that movement limited to routes to/from work, volunteering against covid, and essential matters of everyday life
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
March 24th 2020
"We introduce restrictions on movement

Until April 11, inclusive, it will not be possible to move freely outside of living, health and professional purposes. Therefore, the restriction does not apply to:

    commuting to work . If you are an employee, run your business or farm, you have the right to go to your job. You also have the right to go and purchase goods and services related to your professional activity.
    volunteering. If you are working to fight the coronavirus and helping people in quarantine or who should not leave your home, you may be able to move around as part of this activity.
    dealing with matters necessary for everyday life. You will be able to move around to do the necessary shopping, buy medicine, go to the doctor, look after your relatives, take your dog out.

Important! It will only be possible to travel in a group of up to two people. This restriction does not apply to families. "
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Poland is introducing a general lock-down: until April 11 inclusive, people will not be able to move freely outside unless performing professional activities or completing the necessary needs related to the current affairs of everyday life, including obtaining health or psychological care. date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Poland
October 23rd 2020
"- The elderly, over 70 years of age, are primarily exposed to a serious threat to health and life. That is why we are introducing the "Support the Senior" program. We are asking seniors not to leave the house and not to move around, said Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki.

Solidarity Corps for Supporting Seniors

The just announced program is coordinated by the Ministry of Family and Social Policy. Thanks to it, helping seniors during the coronavirus pandemic and actions taken in this area by the government, local governments and social welfare centers will run more efficiently. The elderly will receive the necessary help in a difficult time from volunteers, non-governmental organizations, scouts, and volunteer fire brigades and the Territorial Defense Forces.

Special helpline for seniors - 22 505 11 11

As part of the Corps, we have launched a special hotline for seniors over 70 years of age. Through it, the elderly will be able to ask for help in activities that require leaving home, and which are hindered by the pandemic.

Senior, are you over 70 and need support?

    Call the hotline on 22 505 11 11 .
    The helpline person will forward your number to a social welfare center in your municipality.
    Wait for the call of the resort employee, who will contact you and arrange all the details.
    The volunteer will provide you with the products or medications you have requested.

#SupportSeniora and take part in the action "
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description:
Poland
November 10th 2021
A new series of rules that allows for olympic athletes to still compete even if their schools are forced to close due to the pandemic....

"The regulation introduces the possibility of:

    changes in the regulations of competitions, olympics and tournaments during the 2021/2022 school year (the same solution as in the 2020/2021 school year);
    in the case of suspension of classes due to the epidemiological situation - completion of apprenticeships of technical students, post-secondary schools and second-level professional schools by August 31, 2022, also if the student has experience in a given profession or carried out volunteering activities and completed an internship professional at an employer or in an individual farm, as part of regional operational programs, as well as when he carries out apprenticeships in the form of an educational project, in cooperation with an employer or a person running an individual farm or in the form of a virtual enterprise (§ 4 section 1a);
    in the event of a suspension of classes due to the epidemiological situation - credit by August 31, 2022 to a student or participant of a given out-of-school form who has experience or carried out activities in the field of volunteering - this experience or volunteering for the implementation of practical training (§5 sec. 3)."

description:
Poland
February 28th 2020
"
What is Coronavirus?

The new SARS-Cov-2 coronavirus causes a disease called COVID-19. The disease is most often manifested by fever, cough, shortness of breath, muscle aches and fatigue.
How common are symptoms?

The severe course of the disease is observed in about 15-20% of people. Deaths occur in 2-3% of sick people. Probably these data are overestimated, because in many people with a mild course of the infection, laboratory confirmation has not been made.
Who is most at risk?

The most vulnerable to severe disease and death are elderly, immunocompromised people accompanied by other diseases, especially chronic ones.
How to protect yourself against the coronavirus?

The virus is spread by airborne droplets. There is currently no vaccine against the new coronavirus. However, other methods of preventing infection, as outlined below, can be used. These methods are also used in the prevention of other diseases transmitted by airborne droplets, such as seasonal flu (where the peak incidence is between January and March each year).
Where have coronavirus infections been reported so far?

The highest number of confirmed cases of infection with the new coronavirus was registered in China (99%), mainly in Hubei province. The remaining people "dragged" the virus to other countries in Asia, Europe, Oceania and North America and infected other people (eg in Germany, France, Great Britain)."
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
March 10th 2020
The chief of Sanitary safety released the following safety guidelines for seniors...
"If possible, limit your stay in public places and ask your relatives for help with daily activities such as shopping, medication, official and postal matters...
Remember to wash your hands frequently with soap and water, and if this is not possible, disinfect them with alcohol-based liquids / gels (min. 60%)....
Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth

Regularly clean or disinfect touch surfaces
...
All places that are often used by household members should be carefully disinfected.
Regularly disinfect your phone and do not use it while eating

Pathogenic microorganisms can easily accumulate on the surface of cell phones. Regularly disinfect your mobile phone (e.g. with wet wipes soaked in a disinfectant). Do not put the phone on the table and do not use it while eating.
Keep a safe distance from the interlocutor

You should maintain a distance of at least 1-1.5 meters...
When coughing and sneezing, cover your mouth and nose with a bent elbow or a tissue - throw the handkerchief into a closed bin as soon as possible and wash your hands using soap and water or disinfect them with alcohol-based agents...
Eat healthy and remember to stay hydrated...
Use proven sources of knowledge about the coronavirus..."
date_end_spec: The policy has an unlimited time span (e.g. recommendation to wash one's hands; passing of a legal bill)
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
October 10th 2020
"The #SupportSeniora campaign

We remind you about the #WspierajSeniora campaign. It is worth helping people from your immediate surroundings. During an ongoing epidemic, it can be done with the limitation of direct contact with other people.

How to help? - Four simple steps:

    download the #SupportSeniora poster (available for download below)
    provide your bearing details - name and phone number
    print it and ...
    hang on your door, cage or on the nearest advertising pole.

Wait for the call!

It is up to us all to deal with the coronavirus epidemic. Therefore, let us be solid and responsible for other people. Sometimes it is enough:

    making purchases,
    walking the dog,
    collection of the parcel from the post office,
    taking a prescription.

This little gesture can save a lot of people"

November 3rd 2020

"The result even in several minutes thanks to antigen tests

Until now, the main test used to confirm a coronavirus infection has been the PCR test. To make testing faster, we will also use antigen tests more often than before. This type of test detects the presence of a viral protein in patients with a high number of viral particles in the epithelium of the respiratory tract. The test result is known from 10 to 30 minutes."

description:
Poland
March 20th 2021
"The AstraZeneca vaccine is safe

The European Medicines Agency has confirmed the effectiveness, safety and high quality of the AstraZeneca vaccine. The EMA stressed that this preparation was not associated with an increase in the overall risk of blood clots in people who received it. Additionally, EMA did not identify any quality or batch-specific problems with AstraZeneki. She also noted that she intends to continue investigating reports on the relationship between blood clots and this preparation.

The Medical Council of Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki also expressly expresses its opinion in the context of the preparation, which recommends the continued use of the AstraZeneca vaccine. "
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Disseminating information related to COVID-19 to the public that is reliable and factually accurate
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
August 30th 2021

The premier added some clarifications to the vaccination program going on at schools...

"J. Polish, mathematics and vaccination against COVID-19 - get vaccinated with your child at school!

To make access to vaccinations even easier, with the new school year, schools across the country are joining pharmacies, shopping malls and mass events. Remember that even the best school equipment with safety measures and following all established rules may not prevent your child from becoming infected. This is why school principals will organize vaccinations in their schools.

The Ministry of Education and Science has prepared an information package on the organization of the vaccination process. It defines the duties and tasks of the school headmaster. These include:

    organizing classes with an educator for students,
    informational and educational meetings with parents,
    collecting declarations from parents regarding the child's participation in vaccination,
    cooperation with the vaccination center,
    arranging a place for vaccination."

description:
Poland
March 20th 2021

Clarification and speed up of vaccination process...

"Currently, registration is underway for vaccinating seniors at the age of 67 and 68. According to the plan, on Monday, March 22, we are starting the registration of seniors born in 1955-1956. However, from Tuesday, March 23, registration for the age group of 1957-1961 will start. On Thursday, March 25, enrollments for seniors over 70 will also be resumed. We encourage you to register, because it is a matter of safety for all of us. "

description:
Poland
February 25th 2020
Those returning from Italy and showing symptoms are responsible contacting the sanitary department by phone or reporting directly to infectious diseases.

Those without symptoms must monitor their own health for the next 14 days.

If in that 14 days you develop symptoms proceed with the earlier regulation

If you had contact with someone who tested positive then contact the sanitary department.

No need to self-quarantine at this moment.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
March 10th 2020
"Every day, police officers, in agreement with sanitary services, are to check whether the quarantined persons are at home. They will also collect information on whether they need help.

- If a patient is in home quarantine, he must be responsible and not put others at risk. Let me remind you that breaking the quarantine may be punishable by the Penal Code or imposed by the sanitary services. I am appealing for reason. If we are under quarantine, we have an obligation to be in a quarantine facility - added the minister. "
A fine of 5,000PLN for not following Quarantine

description:
Poland
September 5th 2020
New guidelines on how to carry out with Quarantines come into effect at the start of Fall.

Border crossing/contact with infected persons reduced to 10 days.

Home Isolation, on day 7 infected persons will be transported on day 8-10 for testing. Extension may be possible if symptoms still present.
Otherwise, isolation may end on day 10.
If still symptomatic, minimum isolation is 13 days.

Importantly, the quarantine is suspended while the test is performed (the way to the smear site and returning home). A quarantine or isolation suspension also happens when we need to see a doctor. In these situations, we do not have to report to the Sanepid. "

description:
Poland
March 29th 2021
New quarantine laws for people coming into poland...

"Rules for travelers coming to Poland from the Schengen area

    Travelers will be quarantined unless they test negative for COVID-19. The test will have to be performed no later than 48 hours before the border is crossed.
    Test type: PCR or antigenic.
    The new rules will apply to all means of transport: collective and individual transport as well as crossing the border on foot.
    Travelers who have been quarantined in Poland will be able to take a test, the negative result of which will release them from quarantine.

Rules for travelers coming to Poland from outside the Schengen area

    Each traveler will be placed in quarantine.
    A test performed in the country of origin of the person will not be released from quarantine.
    Travelers who have been quarantined may take a test in Poland, the negative result of which will release them from quarantine.
    Test type: PCR or antigenic.
"
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: All countries
enforcer: National Government,Police,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
Poland
February 25th 2020
Those returning from Italy and showing symptoms are responsible contacting the sanitary department by phone or reporting directly to infectious diseases.

Those without symptoms must monitor their own health for the next 14 days.

If in that 14 days you develop symptoms proceed with the earlier regulation

If you had contact with someone who tested positive then contact the sanitary department.

No need to self-quarantine at this moment. UPDATE: Ending for those vaccinated:
"In addition, persons entering Poland by plane from outside the Schengen area will generally have to present a negative COVID-19 test no more than 24 hours old from 15 December [2021]. Capacities will also be reduced in public passenger transport."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
March 13th 2020
Restaurants are limited to Take-away or Delivery only

Closure of Gyms, swimming pools, dance clubs, fitness clubs, casinos, entertainment venues, museums, libraries, and cinemas.

Shopping centers and galleries have their functions limited:
Within these centers areas of; textile, clothing, footwear/leather goods, furniture and lighting equipment, radio and television equipment and household appliances, stationery and book selling, as well as all points of entertainment and catering; will be closed.

Laundries, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies, and banks within centers will still operate.

description:
Poland introduced a closure of public services; including bars, restaurants (excluding take-out), shops and spas on the 14th of March. 

Update #1: Measures will be extended until April 19.

Update #2: The polish government announced that from March 31st onwards new public services are included in the list: Hotels, cosmetic and tattoo saloons, massage parlours and hairdressers must close. Stores selling household items such as paints and tiles which have recently seen increased custom must also shut at weekends. Shops that remain open must serve only the elderly from 1000 am till midday. UPDATE: Update #1: The Polish government announced new measures on the 24th of March and added that existing measures would be extended to April 11. Also places of worship may now only have 5 people at a time.
Update #2: The Polish government has announced new restrictions, which include the closure parcs of hotels (unless they are using their rooms to host quarantined travellers). So, there are more services which now fall under the restrictions.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland introduced a closure of public services; including bars, restaurants (excluding take-out), shops and spas on the 14th of March. 
Update 1: Measures will be extended until April 11.
Update 2: More businesses are added to the closure of public services on the 31st of March.
Update 3: Stores are allowed to open up on the 20th of April, under strict regulations about the nr of people in the store at one time. UPDATE: The Polish government announced new measures on the 24th of March and added that existing measures would be extended to April 11. Also places of worship may now only have 5 people at a time.
Update #1: Measures will be extended until April 19.

Update #2: The polish government announced that from March 31st onwards new public services are included in the list: Hotels, cosmetic and tattoo saloons, massage parlours and hairdressers must close. Stores selling household items such as paints and tiles which have recently seen increased custom must also shut at weekends. Shops that remain open must serve only the elderly from 10:00 am till midday.

Update #3: From the 20th of April, businesses are allowed to open again under strict conditions. Stores with a surface of less than 100 sq meters may have 4 people per cashier in the store at one time. Stores with a surface of more than 100 sq meters may have 1 person per 15 sq meters in the store at one time. Still, the stores have to observe hygiene criteria (gloves, disinfectant, social distancing etc).
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Update 3: Stores are allowed to open up on the 20th of April, under strict regulations about the nr of people in the store at one time. UPDATE: The Polish government announced new measures on the 24th of March and added that existing measures would be extended to April 11. Also places of worship may now only have 5 people at a time.
Update #1: Measures will be extended until April 19.

Update #2: The polish government announced that from March 31st onwards new public services are included in the list: Hotels, cosmetic and tattoo saloons, massage parlours and hairdressers must close. Stores selling household items such as paints and tiles which have recently seen increased custom must also shut at weekends. Shops that remain open must serve only the elderly from 10:00 am till midday.

Update #3: From the 20th of April, businesses are allowed to open again under strict conditions. Stores with a surface of less than 100 sq meters may have 4 people per cashier in the store at one time. Stores with a surface of more than 100 sq meters may have 1 person per 15 sq meters in the store at one time. Still, the stores have to observe hygiene criteria (gloves, disinfectant, social distancing etc).
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
March 13th 2020
Restaurants are limited to Take-away or Delivery only

Closure of Gyms, swimming pools, dance clubs, fitness clubs, casinos, entertainment venues, museums, libraries, and cinemas.

Shopping centers and galleries have their functions limited:
Within these centers areas of; textile, clothing, footwear/leather goods, furniture and lighting equipment, radio and television equipment and household appliances, stationery and book selling, as well as all points of entertainment and catering; will be closed.

Laundries, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies, and banks within centers will still operate. UPDATE: The policy was originally set to end March 28th 2020, will now be extended until April 11th 2020
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
March 13th 2020
Restaurants are limited to Take-away or Delivery only

Closure of Gyms, swimming pools, dance clubs, fitness clubs, casinos, entertainment venues, museums, libraries, and cinemas.

Shopping centers and galleries have their functions limited:
Within these centers areas of; textile, clothing, footwear/leather goods, furniture and lighting equipment, radio and television equipment and household appliances, stationery and book selling, as well as all points of entertainment and catering; will be closed.

Laundries, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies, and banks within centers will still operate. UPDATE: Whereas prior, hotels were allowed to operate, now as of April 1st 2020 they are only allowed to operate in order to house quarantine patients.

Additionally, business', that remain open are limited to a 3 clients:1 worker rule.

Worker safety standards, stations must be 1,5meters apart and worker must wear protective gear like gloves.

Full suspension of rehabilitation and beauty centers.

description:
Poland

Shopping centers and galleries have their functions limited:
Within these centers areas of; textile, clothing, footwear/leather goods, furniture and lighting equipment, radio and television equipment and household appliances, stationery and book selling, as well as all points of entertainment and catering; will be closed.

Laundries, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies, and banks within centers will still operate. Within these centers areas of; textile, clothing, footwear/leather goods, furniture and lighting equipment, radio and television equipment and household appliances, stationery and book selling, as well as all points of entertainment and catering; will be closed.

Laundries, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies, and banks within centers will still operate. UPDATE: Whereas prior the policy was set that there could be 2 customers for every 1 employee, as of April 20th 2020, there may be 4 customers for every 1 cashier. The distance of 15meters squared remains.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
institution_status: This type of business  ("Commercial Businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
March 13th 2020

Closure of Gyms, swimming pools, dance clubs, fitness clubs, casinos, entertainment venues, museums, libraries, and cinemas.

Shopping centers and galleries have their functions limited:

Laundries, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies, and banks within centers will still operate. UPDATE: While the original policy was extended indefinitely, now as of May 6th 2020, with the opening of the 2nd stage, Hotels may resume full service; exception that no gyms or pools are to be used.

description:
Poland
March 13th 2020
Restaurants are limited to Take-away or Delivery only

Closure of Gyms, swimming pools, dance clubs, fitness clubs, casinos, entertainment venues, museums, libraries, and cinemas.

Shopping centers and galleries have their functions limited:
Within these centers areas of; textile, clothing, footwear/leather goods, furniture and lighting equipment, radio and television equipment and household appliances, stationery and book selling, as well as all points of entertainment and catering; will be closed.

Laundries, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies, and banks within centers will still operate. UPDATE: Whereas prior there was a total closure of Gyms, now as a part of the Stage 3 reopenings, and starting May 17th/18th 2020 the ability to do more outdoor sports is expanding to allow more sports following certain safety guidelines.

"
        12 people + trainer (in facilities up to 300 m2),
        16 people + 2 trainers (in facilities from 301 to 800 m2),
        24 people + 2 trainers (in facilities from 801 to 1000 m2),
        32 people + 3 trainers (in facilities over 1000 m2)."
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down

Restaurants are limited to Take-away or Delivery only

Closure of Gyms, swimming pools, dance clubs, fitness clubs, casinos, entertainment venues, museums, libraries, and cinemas.

Shopping centers and galleries have their functions limited:
Within these centers areas of; textile, clothing, footwear/leather goods, furniture and lighting equipment, radio and television equipment and household appliances, stationery and book selling, as well as all points of entertainment and catering; will be closed.

Laundries, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies, and banks within centers will still operate. UPDATE: On June 6th 2020, following the 4th stage of reopenings, all indoor gym activities, massages, spas, and fairs may resume following sanitary conditions.
Outdoor events may return on May 30th 2020
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 14th of March a closure of non essential businesses was announced by the Polish government, this was made stricter to include more businesses on the 31st of March. The Polish government has since in steps allowed certain business to open up. on 6th June it will open the remaining businesses: cinemas, theatres, operas, ballet, swimming pools, gyms, fitness clubs, play rooms, and theme parks. Fairs, exhibitions, and congresses will also be allowed. Saunas, solaria, tatoo and massage salons will also be opened (from 30th of May) UPDATE: On the 14th of March a closure of non essential businesses was announced by the Polish government, this was made stricter to include more businesses on the 31st of March. The Polish government has gradually opened them up and on 6th June it will open the remainin businesses: cinemas, theatres, operas, ballet, swimming pools, gyms, fitness clubs, play rooms, and theme parks. Fairs, exhibitions, and congresses will also be allowed. Saunas, solaria, tatoo and massage salons will also be opened (from 30th of May)

institution_status: This type of business  ("Commercial Businesses") is closed/locked down

description:
Poland
March 13th 2020
Restaurants are limited to Take-away or Delivery only

Closure of Gyms, swimming pools, dance clubs, fitness clubs, casinos, entertainment venues, museums, libraries, and cinemas.

Shopping centers and galleries have their functions limited:
Within these centers areas of; textile, clothing, footwear/leather goods, furniture and lighting equipment, radio and television equipment and household appliances, stationery and book selling, as well as all points of entertainment and catering; will be closed.

Laundries, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies, and banks within centers will still operate. UPDATE: Whereas prior there was a mandate to alternate seats now...
"From July 25, 2020, the obligation to alternately occupy seats in cinemas and at artistic and entertainment events that take place indoors will be lifted. This applies to music clubs, sports and entertainment halls, as well as amphitheaters and band shells."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Retail Businesses") is closed/locked down

description:
Poland
March 13th 2020
Restaurants are limited to Take-away or Delivery only

Closure of Gyms, swimming pools, dance clubs, fitness clubs, casinos, entertainment venues, museums, libraries, and cinemas.

Shopping centers and galleries have their functions limited:
Within these centers areas of; textile, clothing, footwear/leather goods, furniture and lighting equipment, radio and television equipment and household appliances, stationery and book selling, as well as all points of entertainment and catering; will be closed.

Laundries, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies, and banks within centers will still operate. UPDATE: On July 24th 2020....
"In the case of swimming pools (indoor and outdoor), there will be no limit on the number of participants. However, it will remain in water parks. In water amusement parks there will be a limit of up to 75 percent. occupancy of the object.

At the swimming pools, the audience will be able to occupy every other seat in the audience (in alternating rows). "
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Poland
March 13th 2020
Restaurants are limited to Take-away or Delivery only

Closure of Gyms, swimming pools, dance clubs, fitness clubs, casinos, entertainment venues, museums, libraries, and cinemas.

Shopping centers and galleries have their functions limited:
Within these centers areas of; textile, clothing, footwear/leather goods, furniture and lighting equipment, radio and television equipment and household appliances, stationery and book selling, as well as all points of entertainment and catering; will be closed.

Laundries, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies, and banks within centers will still operate. UPDATE: On July 25th 2020
While pools are reopening....
"However, it will remain in water parks. In water amusement parks there will be a limit of up to 75 percent. occupancy of the object."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
institution_status: This type of business  ("Commercial Businesses") is closed/locked down
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
October 8th 2020

"In order to minimize the spread of the coronavirus, eateries in the red zone will be able to open at certain times - from 6:00 to 22:00. There should be a safe distance in such places throughout the country - there should be at least 4 m 2 per person.  

Also throughout the country, no places for dancing can be made available in restaurants and other closed rooms. "

description:
Poland
October 8th 2020

"Cultural events on new rules

There is a total ban on organizing and participating in cultural events in the red zone. In cinemas, however, may be 25 percent. the audience. How is it in the rest of the country?

In a confined space, this type of event can take place with the participation of 25%. audience - the same rule applies in cinemas. A maximum of 100 people can participate in cultural events that take place outdoors - however, the number of viewers, listeners, visitors or participants must not exceed 1 person per 5 m 2 . "
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

Different rules applying for red and yellow zones, here is the regulation for red zone eateries...

eateries may be open from 6:00 a.m. - 9:00 p.m. Every other table may be occupied. After 21:00 only take-away meals can be ordered..." description:
Poland
November 27th 2020

"
    Gastronomy - only "take-away" and "take-away" activities.

    Hairdressing and beauty salons - functioning in the sanitary regime - at least 1.5 m distance between stands and no more than 1 person per 1 service stand, except for the service. 

Activities suspended

    Cultural events and cinemas - with the exception of activities necessary for the preparation of artistic events such as rehearsals and exercises, phonographic and audiovisual recordings and events transmitted by means of direct distance communication - without the participation of the public.
    Hotels - with the exception of guests on a business trip, athletes, medical staff as well as patients and their carers.
    Trade fairs and events - only in the on-line form.
    Weddings, communions and consoles
    Theme parks
    Gyms, fitness clubs and water parks
    Discos and nightclubs"
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Delivery and Takeaway Only
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
November 27th

"The continuing high number of COVID-19 cases does not allow for far-reaching lifting of restrictions and limitations. From November 28, 2020, however, we will restore the possibility of the operation of shops and services in shopping malls and retail parks under a strict sanitary regime. The only exception is the activity of playrooms. There will be a limit of people in shops, shopping malls and post offices:

- 1 person per 10 m2 in the case of facilities not larger than 100 m2,

- 1 person per 15 m2 in the case of facilities larger than 100 m2.

There will still be hours for seniors - from Monday to Friday from 10:00 - 12:00."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Shopping Centers") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Restriction of number of customers,Restriction of business hours (if applicable note the hours of business in text entry)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

    Hairdressing and beauty salons - functioning in the sanitary regime - at least 1.5 m distance between stands and no more than 1 person per 1 service stand, except for the service. 

Activities suspended

    Cultural events and cinemas - with the exception of activities necessary for the preparation of artistic events such as rehearsals and exercises, phonographic and audiovisual recordings and events transmitted by means of direct distance communication - without the participation of the public.
    Hotels - with the exception of guests on a business trip, athletes, medical staff as well as patients and their carers.
    Trade fairs and events - only in the on-line form.
    Weddings, communions and consoles
    Theme parks
    Gyms, fitness clubs and water parks
    Discos and nightclubs" UPDATE: The policy originally set to end December 28th 2020 will now end January 17th 2021

description:
Poland
November 27th

"The continuing high number of COVID-19 cases does not allow for far-reaching lifting of restrictions and limitations. From November 28, 2020, however, we will restore the possibility of the operation of shops and services in shopping malls and retail parks under a strict sanitary regime. The only exception is the activity of playrooms. There will be a limit of people in shops, shopping malls and post offices:

- 1 person per 10 m2 in the case of facilities not larger than 100 m2,

- 1 person per 15 m2 in the case of facilities larger than 100 m2.

There will still be hours for seniors - from Monday to Friday from 10:00 - 12:00." UPDATE: The policy was originally set to end on January 17th 2021 will now be extended until the 31st of January
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Shopping Centers") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Restriction of number of customers,Restriction of business hours (if applicable note the hours of business in text entry)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
January 28th 2021
"Shopping malls, museums and art galleries reopen from February 1st

Shops in galleries and shopping centers

From February 1, it will be possible to reopen stores in shopping centers and malls. Such places, however, will have to operate in a strict sanitary regime .

Customer limits in stores

In commercial establishments, at the market or the post office, there is a customer limit :

    1 person / 10 m2 - in shops up to 100 m2
    1 person / 15 m2 - in stores over 100 m2

Important! Restaurants and food outlets in shopping centers and malls remain closed. It is only possible to deliver and serve food to take away.

Important! From February 1, the senior hours will not apply.

Museums and art galleries

From February 1, museums and art galleries will also be able to operate under strict sanitary regime. "
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
institution_status: This type of business  ("Shopping Centers") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Restriction of number of customers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Gyms still closed.
Restaurants - as before - will be able to provide take-out and delivery meals.

description:
Poland
November 27th 2020

"
    Gastronomy - only "take-away" and "take-away" activities.

    Hairdressing and beauty salons - functioning in the sanitary regime - at least 1.5 m distance between stands and no more than 1 person per 1 service stand, except for the service. 

Activities suspended

    Cultural events and cinemas - with the exception of activities necessary for the preparation of artistic events such as rehearsals and exercises, phonographic and audiovisual recordings and events transmitted by means of direct distance communication - without the participation of the public.

    Theme parks

description:
Poland
January 28th 2021
"Shopping malls, museums and art galleries reopen from February 1st

Shops in galleries and shopping centers

From February 1, it will be possible to reopen stores in shopping centers and malls. Such places, however, will have to operate in a strict sanitary regime .

Customer limits in stores

In commercial establishments, at the market or the post office, there is a customer limit :

    1 person / 10 m2 - in shops up to 100 m2
    1 person / 15 m2 - in stores over 100 m2

Important! Restaurants and food outlets in shopping centers and malls remain closed. It is only possible to deliver and serve food to take away.

Important! From February 1, the senior hours will not apply.

Museums and art galleries

From February 1, museums and art galleries will also be able to operate under strict sanitary regime. " UPDATE: The policy will be extended until March 28th 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Shopping Centers") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Restriction of number of customers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
November 27th

"The continuing high number of COVID-19 cases does not allow for far-reaching lifting of restrictions and limitations. From November 28, 2020, however, we will restore the possibility of the operation of shops and services in shopping malls and retail parks under a strict sanitary regime. The only exception is the activity of playrooms. There will be a limit of people in shops, shopping malls and post offices:

- 1 person per 10 m2 in the case of facilities not larger than 100 m2,

- 1 person per 15 m2 in the case of facilities larger than 100 m2.

There will still be hours for seniors - from Monday to Friday from 10:00 - 12:00." UPDATE: The policy will be extended until March 28th 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Shopping Centers") is allowed to open with conditions

description:
Poland
November 27th

"The continuing high number of COVID-19 cases does not allow for far-reaching lifting of restrictions and limitations. From November 28, 2020, however, we will restore the possibility of the operation of shops and services in shopping malls and retail parks under a strict sanitary regime. The only exception is the activity of playrooms. There will be a limit of people in shops, shopping malls and post offices:

- 1 person per 10 m2 in the case of facilities not larger than 100 m2,

- 1 person per 15 m2 in the case of facilities larger than 100 m2.

There will still be hours for seniors - from Monday to Friday from 10:00 - 12:00." UPDATE: All policies in Poland set to end March 28th 2021 will now end April 9th 2021
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Shopping Centers") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Restriction of number of customers,Restriction of business hours (if applicable note the hours of business in text entry)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
January 28th 2021
"Shopping malls, museums and art galleries reopen from February 1st

Shops in galleries and shopping centers

From February 1, it will be possible to reopen stores in shopping centers and malls. Such places, however, will have to operate in a strict sanitary regime .

Customer limits in stores

In commercial establishments, at the market or the post office, there is a customer limit :

    1 person / 10 m2 - in shops up to 100 m2
    1 person / 15 m2 - in stores over 100 m2

Important! Restaurants and food outlets in shopping centers and malls remain closed. It is only possible to deliver and serve food to take away.

Important! From February 1, the senior hours will not apply.

Museums and art galleries

From February 1, museums and art galleries will also be able to operate under strict sanitary regime. " UPDATE: The policy was originally set to 10 and 15m2 per person and as of March 27th 2021 it will be increased to 15 and 20m2 per person respective of building size
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Shopping Centers") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Restriction of number of customers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

February 12th 2021

"Hotels - available to everyone while maintaining the sanitary regime (50% of available rooms, meals only served in rooms, at guests' request. Hotel restaurants - closed)." UPDATE: The policy was originally set to end April 9th 2021 will now end on April 18th 2021
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Commercial Businesses") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Restriction of number of customers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
November 27th 2020

"
    Gastronomy - only "take-away" and "take-away" activities.

    Hairdressing and beauty salons - functioning in the sanitary regime - at least 1.5 m distance between stands and no more than 1 person per 1 service stand, except for the service. 

Activities suspended

    Cultural events and cinemas - with the exception of activities necessary for the preparation of artistic events such as rehearsals and exercises, phonographic and audiovisual recordings and events transmitted by means of direct distance communication - without the participation of the public.
    Hotels - with the exception of guests on a business trip, athletes, medical staff as well as patients and their carers.
    Trade fairs and events - only in the on-line form.
    Weddings, communions and consoles
    Theme parks
    Gyms, fitness clubs and water parks
    Discos and nightclubs" UPDATE: The policy was originally set to end April 9th 2021 will now end on April 18th 2021
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Delivery and Takeaway Only
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
November 27th

"The continuing high number of COVID-19 cases does not allow for far-reaching lifting of restrictions and limitations. From November 28, 2020, however, we will restore the possibility of the operation of shops and services in shopping malls and retail parks under a strict sanitary regime. The only exception is the activity of playrooms. There will be a limit of people in shops, shopping malls and post offices:

- 1 person per 10 m2 in the case of facilities not larger than 100 m2,

- 1 person per 15 m2 in the case of facilities larger than 100 m2.

There will still be hours for seniors - from Monday to Friday from 10:00 - 12:00." UPDATE: The policy is once again being extended until April 25th 2021
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_status: This type of business  ("Shopping Centers") is allowed to open with conditions
institution_conditions: Restriction of number of customers,Restriction of business hours (if applicable note the hours of business in text entry)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
March 11th 2021
The following are suspended from the 15th of March to the 28th 2021 in Mazowieckie and Lubuskie...

"saunas, solariums, Turkish baths, slimming salons, casinos
hotels (exceptions include workers' hotels, as well as accommodation provided as part of business trips - the exact catalog of exceptions along with the required confirmation of a business trip will be included in the regulation);
shopping malls - with the exception of: grocery stores, pharmacies and drugstores, press salons, bookstores, pet stores and DIY stores. In shopping malls, they will still be able to operate, among others hairdressing, optics, banking, laundry services.
cinemasfitness clubs and gyms" UPDATE: The policy is once again being extended until April 25th 2021
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Poland
February 24th 2021
"The epidemic situation in the Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship is particularly difficult. 1/3 of the results of tests performed in the voivodship gives a positive result, therefore we are tightening the safety rules in this region. From February 27, hotels, shopping malls, cinemas, theaters, museums, art galleries, swimming pools and tennis courts will be closed. " UPDATE: The policy is once again being extended until April 25th 2021

November 27th 2020

"
    Gastronomy - only "take-away" and "take-away" activities.

description:
Poland
October 8th 2020

"Cultural events on new rules

There is a total ban on organizing and participating in cultural events in the red zone. In cinemas, however, may be 25 percent. the audience. How is it in the rest of the country?

In a confined space, this type of event can take place with the participation of 25%. audience - the same rule applies in cinemas. A maximum of 100 people can participate in cultural events that take place outdoors - however, the number of viewers, listeners, visitors or participants must not exceed 1 person per 5 m 2 . " UPDATE: Ending of Policy: "Update 2021-07-19: On Monday (19 July), the FCDO summarised the recent easing of COVID-19 measures in public spaces: Outdoor and indoor gatherings and events are now allowed in Poland with up to 150 participants. Public transport is fully operational again, cultural facilities such as museums, theatres and cinemas are open, as are national parks, beaches and sports facilities. All shops are also open again. Masks are mandatory in enclosed public spaces and on public transport."

description:
Poland
March 13th 2020
Restaurants are limited to Take-away or Delivery only

Closure of Gyms, swimming pools, dance clubs, fitness clubs, casinos, entertainment venues, museums, libraries, and cinemas.

Shopping centers and galleries have their functions limited:
Within these centers areas of; textile, clothing, footwear/leather goods, furniture and lighting equipment, radio and television equipment and household appliances, stationery and book selling, as well as all points of entertainment and catering; will be closed.

Laundries, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies, and banks within centers will still operate.

description:
Poland
March 31st 2020
"It is forbidden to use parks, beaches, boulevards, promenades and city bikes

We are also introducing a ban on access to beaches and green areas that perform public functions. Therefore, the ban applies to parks, lawns, promenades, boulevards, botanical and zoological gardens, and Jordanian gardens. Recent experiences show that these are places where people accumulate and thus increase the chances of infection.

For this reason, we limit the use of city bikes. "

Closure of Gyms, swimming pools, dance clubs, fitness clubs, casinos, entertainment venues, museums, libraries, and cinemas.

Shopping centers and galleries have their functions limited:
Within these centers areas of; textile, clothing, footwear/leather goods, furniture and lighting equipment, radio and television equipment and household appliances, stationery and book selling, as well as all points of entertainment and catering; will be closed.

Laundries, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies, and banks within centers will still operate.
 UPDATE: The policy, in regards to sports venues, was originally left with an ambiguous ending, now starting May 4th through to June 12th 2020, as the 2nd stage of the 4 stage reopening, various sports centers will be reopening, starting with sports facilities and ending with speedways. Following these reopenings, general safety measures are still in place, such as mask wearing.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type: Restriction and Regulation of Government Services
institution_status: This service is no longer provided by the government
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
