description:
Poland
March 13th 2020
Restaurants are limited to Take-away or Delivery only

Closure of Gyms, swimming pools, dance clubs, fitness clubs, casinos, entertainment venues, museums, libraries, and cinemas.

Shopping centers and galleries have their functions limited:
Within these centers areas of; textile, clothing, footwear/leather goods, furniture and lighting equipment, radio and television equipment and household appliances, stationery and book selling, as well as all points of entertainment and catering; will be closed.

Laundries, grocery stores, drugstores, pharmacies, and banks within centers will still operate.
 UPDATE: Whereas prior, venues were allowed open with size restrictions, now as of July 24th 2020, Football stadiums may operate at 50% capacity, Conferences, Fairs, and exhibitions may operate at 2,5 meters squared distance per person, swimming pools may have no limit but waterparks must be kept to 75%, seat alternation in clubs or music events is removed as well. 
Social distancing policies in general are now reduced to 1,5

description:
Poland
March 31st 2020
"
    Post offices - 2 people per 1 post office

As many people as the number of post office counters multiplied by 2 may be present in the post office at any one time. " UPDATE: Ending of Policy:
"Update 2021-07-19: On Monday (19 July), the FCDO summarised the recent easing of COVID-19 measures in public spaces: Outdoor and indoor gatherings and events are now allowed in Poland with up to 150 participants. Public transport is fully operational again, cultural facilities such as museums, theatres and cinemas are open, as are national parks, beaches and sports facilities. All shops are also open again. Masks are mandatory in enclosed public spaces and on public transport."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Poland
March 11th 2021
The following are suspended in Mazowieckie and Lubuskie...

theaters, museums, art galleries UPDATE: Update 2021-07-19: On Monday (19 July), the FCDO summarised the recent easing of COVID-19 measures in public spaces: Outdoor and indoor gatherings and events are now allowed in Poland with up to 150 participants. Public transport is fully operational again, cultural facilities such as museums, theatres and cinemas are open, as are national parks, beaches and sports facilities. All shops are also open again. Masks are mandatory in enclosed public spaces and on public transport.
FCDO
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description:
Poland
November 2nd 2021
The government announced extensions on licenses due to COVID...
"The most important solutions:

    It will be possible to maintain the validity of seafarers' documents up to 90 days from the cancellation of an epidemic emergency or an epidemic.
    The co-financing of compensations for the provision of public collective transport services in passenger rail transport, commissioned by the organizers, will be extended until 31 December 2021. It will be financed from the state budget provided for honoring the statutory entitlement to discounted journeys by means of collective public transport.
    The validity of the river basin management plans and the flood risk management plans for the river basin districts will be extended by 12 months.
    They will be exempt from the obligation to pay fees for inland waterway vessels. These are ships that are used in business activities, consisting in the transport of cargo, passengers and the performance of technical works. This also applies to natural persons who navigate on waterways during the 2022 shipping season.
    The Minister of Infrastructure will take over the tasks in the field of water drainage in order to carry out a reform combating drought in agriculture."
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)

description: Prime Minister Mateusz Morawiecki decided on Tuesday March 10 to cancel all mass events in the country, among other preventive measures undertaken to contain the virus. A mass gathering is defined as at least 1000 people at locations other than buildings, or at least 500 people inside a building.

description: The Polish government is issuing a complete ban on gatherings of more than 2 persons from March 24th onwards. There are two exceptions: families (i.e. 2 parents walking with their 2 children is allowed) and places of worship (maximum of 5 people).

description: The Polish government is issuing a complete ban on gatherings of more than 2 persons from March 24th onwards. There are two exceptions: families (i.e. 2 parents walking with their 2 children is allowed) and places of worship (maximum of 1 person per 15 sq meters - before April 20th this was a max of 5 people in total). UPDATE: Originally, only 5 people were allowed to convene in places of worship. On the 20th of April this has been changed to 1 person per 15 sq meters. Other restrictions remain in place.

Poland
March 13th 2020
"Since large crowds of people are an environment conducive to the spread of the coronavirus, we have decided to ban all public, state and religious gatherings. There may not be more than 50 people in one place, including the organizer and persons acting on his behalf. " UPDATE: Whereas prior, the amount allowed was 50, now, as of March 24th 2020, there is a total ban except for visiting loved ones and church. However, in regards to church, only 5 may assemble

description:
Poland
September 29th 2020
"“In ‘red’ zones, the limit of up to 50 people taking part in gatherings is retained. In ‘yellow’ and ‘green’ zones it will be up to 75 and 100 people respectively,” Mr Niedzielski said. Weddings in the green zones can only involve 100 people, instead of the previous 150." UPDATE: The original policy has ended. Pursuant to the Regulation of the Council of Ministers of 25 March 2022 on establishing specific restrictions, orders, and prohibitions in relation to the state of the epidemic (Polish Journal of Laws, item 673), from 28 March 2022 onwards, all restrictions are lifted.

"
    Assemblies and meetings:

    a maximum of 5 people may participate in the assembly, and the distance between the assemblies must not be less than 100 m;
    events organized at home - with the participation of a maximum of 5 people (this limit does not include the person inviting to the party and people who live or manage with this person).
" UPDATE: The policy is further extended until August 31st 2021 and will now allow....

"Assembly

Up to 150 people can participate in all types of gatherings. Participants are required to keep a distance of 1.5 m from other people. Moreover, the distance between assemblies cannot be less than 100 m.

Meetings

meetings organized outdoors or or in a separate zone in events and indoors Up to 150 people can participate . There is a distance between the tables (every other table may be occupied, the distance between the tables must be at least 1.5 m - unless there is a partition between them with a height of at least 1 m, counting from the surface of the table)

The limit does not apply to persons fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

Valid until August 31 "

description:
Poland
March 24th 2020
"The number of people on a bus is equal to half the number of seats

Collective public transport is still operational. However, on the bus, tram or subway, only half of the seats may be occupied. If there are 70 seats in a vehicle, a maximum of 35 people can be on board. "

update_level_var: Volume of policy relaxing ; timing of policy relaxing
description:
Poland
March 24th 2020
"The number of people on a bus is equal to half the number of seats

Collective public transport is still operational. However, on the bus, tram or subway, only half of the seats may be occupied. If there are 70 seats in a vehicle, a maximum of 35 people can be on board. " UPDATE: Whereas prior the policy had a max amount of people per the seating place, staring May 18th 2020 and as a part of the 3rd stage of reopening, the standing area of a vehicle is also accounted for in the "max" amount of people allowed.

"
    As much as half the seating capacity (as it is today)

or

    as much as 30% of the total number of seating and standing positions (in this case, however, half of the seating positions must remain free).

Example If a bus has 30 seats and 70 standing places (i.e. 100 in total), then 30 people can drive it at the same time. Half of the seats must remain free. Until now, 15 people could enter such a bus. "
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Restrictions on ridership of subways and trams
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

Poland
March 31st 2020
2 meters between pedestrians at all times, indoor or outdoors. UPDATE: Whereas prior, people were mandated to keep a 2meters distance and wear masks at all times.

description:
Poland
September 1st 2020
"According to the guidelines prepared by the ministries of health and education, together with the chief sanitary inspector, a student without symptoms of respiratory tract infection and when the household members are not in quarantine or isolation can attend school.

General rules of hygiene apply in schools: frequent hand washing (immediately upon arrival at school), protection when sneezing and coughing, and avoiding touching eyes, nose and mouth. People entering the school building should be able to use hand sanitizer. If it is possible, in the cloakroom every other box should be made available to students or different hours of coming to school should be introduced.

As far as possible, work is to be organized in such a way as to keep the distance between people staying at school and limit the gathering of students. Students and teachers in classrooms do not have to wear masks covering their mouth and nose. "
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education,Provincial/State Government,Municipal Government

description:
Poland
October 8th 2020

"In order to minimize the spread of the coronavirus, eateries in the red zone will be able to open at certain times - from 6:00 to 22:00. There should be a safe distance in such places throughout the country - there should be at least 4 m 2 per person.  

Also throughout the country, no places for dancing can be made available in restaurants and other closed rooms. "
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
October 8th 2020

"Cultural events on new rules

There is a total ban on organizing and participating in cultural events in the red zone. In cinemas, however, may be 25 percent. the audience. How is it in the rest of the country?

In a confined space, this type of event can take place with the participation of 25%. audience - the same rule applies in cinemas. A maximum of 100 people can participate in cultural events that take place outdoors - however, the number of viewers, listeners, visitors or participants must not exceed 1 person per 5 m 2 . "
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:

Different rules applying for red and yellow zones, here is the regulation for red zone eateries...

"limiting the number of people in commercial outlets to 5 people per 1 cash register....

description:
Poland
October 8th 2020

"In order to minimize the spread of the coronavirus, eateries in the red zone will be able to open at certain times - from 6:00 to 22:00. There should be a safe distance in such places throughout the country - there should be at least 4 m 2 per person.  

Also throughout the country, no places for dancing can be made available in restaurants and other closed rooms. " UPDATE: Whereas prior, there were red and yellow zones and with the advent of the whole country being determined "red", this policy is being extended until November 29th 2020
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Restaurants
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
November 27th 2020

"
    Gastronomy - only "take-away" and "take-away" activities.

    Hairdressing and beauty salons - functioning in the sanitary regime - at least 1.5 m distance between stands and no more than 1 person per 1 service stand, except for the service. 

Activities suspended

    Cultural events and cinemas - with the exception of activities necessary for the preparation of artistic events such as rehearsals and exercises, phonographic and audiovisual recordings and events transmitted by means of direct distance communication - without the participation of the public.
    Hotels - with the exception of guests on a business trip, athletes, medical staff as well as patients and their carers.
    Trade fairs and events - only in the on-line form.
    Weddings, communions and consoles
    Theme parks
    Gyms, fitness clubs and water parks
    Discos and nightclubs"
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
November 27th

"The continuing high number of COVID-19 cases does not allow for far-reaching lifting of restrictions and limitations. From November 28, 2020, however, we will restore the possibility of the operation of shops and services in shopping malls and retail parks under a strict sanitary regime. The only exception is the activity of playrooms. There will be a limit of people in shops, shopping malls and post offices:

- 1 person per 10 m2 in the case of facilities not larger than 100 m2,

- 1 person per 15 m2 in the case of facilities larger than 100 m2.

There will still be hours for seniors - from Monday to Friday from 10:00 - 12:00."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Shopping Centers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

"
    Gastronomy - only "take-away" and "take-away" activities.

    Hairdressing and beauty salons - functioning in the sanitary regime - at least 1.5 m distance between stands and no more than 1 person per 1 service stand, except for the service.

    Cultural events and cinemas - with the exception of activities necessary for the preparation of artistic events such as rehearsals and exercises, phonographic and audiovisual recordings and events transmitted by means of direct distance communication - without the participation of the public.

    Trade fairs and events - only in the on-line form.
    Weddings, communions and consoles
    Theme parks
    Gyms, fitness clubs and water parks
    Discos and nightclubs" UPDATE: The policy was originally set to end on January 17th 2021 will now be extended until the 31st of January

description:
Poland
November 27th

"The continuing high number of COVID-19 cases does not allow for far-reaching lifting of restrictions and limitations. From November 28, 2020, however, we will restore the possibility of the operation of shops and services in shopping malls and retail parks under a strict sanitary regime. The only exception is the activity of playrooms. There will be a limit of people in shops, shopping malls and post offices:

- 1 person per 10 m2 in the case of facilities not larger than 100 m2,

- 1 person per 15 m2 in the case of facilities larger than 100 m2.

There will still be hours for seniors - from Monday to Friday from 10:00 - 12:00." UPDATE: The policy was originally set to end on January 17th 2021 will now be extended until the 31st of January
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Shopping Centers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
January 28th 2021
"Shopping malls, museums and art galleries reopen from February 1st

Shops in galleries and shopping centers

From February 1, it will be possible to reopen stores in shopping centers and malls. Such places, however, will have to operate in a strict sanitary regime .

Customer limits in stores

In commercial establishments, at the market or the post office, there is a customer limit :

    1 person / 10 m2 - in shops up to 100 m2
    1 person / 15 m2 - in stores over 100 m2

Important! Restaurants and food outlets in shopping centers and malls remain closed. It is only possible to deliver and serve food to take away.

Important! From February 1, the senior hours will not apply.

Museums and art galleries

From February 1, museums and art galleries will also be able to operate under strict sanitary regime. "
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Shopping Centers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
November 27th 2020

"
    Gastronomy - only "take-away" and "take-away" activities.

    Hairdressing and beauty salons - functioning in the sanitary regime - at least 1.5 m distance between stands and no more than 1 person per 1 service stand, except for the service. 

Activities suspended

    Cultural events and cinemas - with the exception of activities necessary for the preparation of artistic events such as rehearsals and exercises, phonographic and audiovisual recordings and events transmitted by means of direct distance communication - without the participation of the public.
    Hotels - with the exception of guests on a business trip, athletes, medical staff as well as patients and their carers.
    Trade fairs and events - only in the on-line form.
    Weddings, communions and consoles
    Theme parks
    Gyms, fitness clubs and water parks
    Discos and nightclubs" UPDATE: On February 12th the following changes will take effect....
Hotels - available to everyone while maintaining the sanitary regime (50% of available rooms, meals only served in rooms, at guests' request. Hotel restaurants - closed).
Cinemas, theaters, operas and concert halls reopened - a maximum of 50% of the seats may be occupied during cultural events. Masks are obligatory. Prohibition of consumption.
slopes Open
Open outdoor pitches, courts, etc. - amateur outdoor sport resumed.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
January 28th 2021
"Shopping malls, museums and art galleries reopen from February 1st

Shops in galleries and shopping centers

From February 1, it will be possible to reopen stores in shopping centers and malls. Such places, however, will have to operate in a strict sanitary regime .

Customer limits in stores

In commercial establishments, at the market or the post office, there is a customer limit :

    1 person / 10 m2 - in shops up to 100 m2
    1 person / 15 m2 - in stores over 100 m2

Important! Restaurants and food outlets in shopping centers and malls remain closed. It is only possible to deliver and serve food to take away.

Important! From February 1, the senior hours will not apply.

Museums and art galleries

From February 1, museums and art galleries will also be able to operate under strict sanitary regime. " UPDATE: The policy will be extended until March 28th 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Shopping Centers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
November 27th

"The continuing high number of COVID-19 cases does not allow for far-reaching lifting of restrictions and limitations. From November 28, 2020, however, we will restore the possibility of the operation of shops and services in shopping malls and retail parks under a strict sanitary regime. The only exception is the activity of playrooms. There will be a limit of people in shops, shopping malls and post offices:

- 1 person per 10 m2 in the case of facilities not larger than 100 m2,

- 1 person per 15 m2 in the case of facilities larger than 100 m2.

There will still be hours for seniors - from Monday to Friday from 10:00 - 12:00." UPDATE: The policy will be extended until March 28th 2021.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Shopping Centers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
November 27th

"The continuing high number of COVID-19 cases does not allow for far-reaching lifting of restrictions and limitations. From November 28, 2020, however, we will restore the possibility of the operation of shops and services in shopping malls and retail parks under a strict sanitary regime. The only exception is the activity of playrooms. There will be a limit of people in shops, shopping malls and post offices:

- 1 person per 10 m2 in the case of facilities not larger than 100 m2,

- 1 person per 15 m2 in the case of facilities larger than 100 m2.

There will still be hours for seniors - from Monday to Friday from 10:00 - 12:00." UPDATE: All policies in Poland set to end March 28th 2021 will now end April 9th 2021
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Shopping Centers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

update_level_var: Volume of policy strengthening ; timing of policy strengthening
description:
Poland
January 28th 2021
"Shopping malls, museums and art galleries reopen from February 1st

Shops in galleries and shopping centers

From February 1, it will be possible to reopen stores in shopping centers and malls. Such places, however, will have to operate in a strict sanitary regime .

Customer limits in stores

In commercial establishments, at the market or the post office, there is a customer limit :

    1 person / 10 m2 - in shops up to 100 m2
    1 person / 15 m2 - in stores over 100 m2

Important! Restaurants and food outlets in shopping centers and malls remain closed. It is only possible to deliver and serve food to take away.

Important! From February 1, the senior hours will not apply.

Museums and art galleries

From February 1, museums and art galleries will also be able to operate under strict sanitary regime. " UPDATE: The policy was originally set to 10 and 15m2 per person and as of March 27th 2021 it will be increased to 15 and 20m2 per person respective of building size
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Shopping Centers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
November 27th

"The continuing high number of COVID-19 cases does not allow for far-reaching lifting of restrictions and limitations. From November 28, 2020, however, we will restore the possibility of the operation of shops and services in shopping malls and retail parks under a strict sanitary regime. The only exception is the activity of playrooms. There will be a limit of people in shops, shopping malls and post offices:

- 1 person per 10 m2 in the case of facilities not larger than 100 m2,

- 1 person per 15 m2 in the case of facilities larger than 100 m2.

There will still be hours for seniors - from Monday to Friday from 10:00 - 12:00." UPDATE: The policy is once again being extended until April 25th 2021
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Shopping Centers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
November 27th 2020

"
    Gastronomy - only "take-away" and "take-away" activities.

    Hairdressing and beauty salons - functioning in the sanitary regime - at least 1.5 m distance between stands and no more than 1 person per 1 service stand, except for the service. 

Activities suspended

    Cultural events and cinemas - with the exception of activities necessary for the preparation of artistic events such as rehearsals and exercises, phonographic and audiovisual recordings and events transmitted by means of direct distance communication - without the participation of the public.
    Hotels - with the exception of guests on a business trip, athletes, medical staff as well as patients and their carers.
    Trade fairs and events - only in the on-line form.
    Weddings, communions and consoles
    Theme parks
    Gyms, fitness clubs and water parks
    Discos and nightclubs" UPDATE: On april 28th 2021 it was announced the ending or relaxing of several policies. With that Starting May 15th 2021 Outdoor restaurants may reopen and May 29th 2021 indoor restaurants may reopen
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

    activities in a strict sanitary regime - incl. safe distance between the tables and the limit of people per table" UPDATE: Update 2021-07-19: On Monday (19 July), the FCDO summarised the recent easing of COVID-19 measures in public spaces: Outdoor and indoor gatherings and events are now allowed in Poland with up to 150 participants. Public transport is fully operational again, cultural facilities such as museums, theatres and cinemas are open, as are national parks, beaches and sports facilities. All shops are also open again. Masks are mandatory in enclosed public spaces and on public transport.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
October 8th 2020

"Cultural events on new rules

There is a total ban on organizing and participating in cultural events in the red zone. In cinemas, however, may be 25 percent. the audience. How is it in the rest of the country?

In a confined space, this type of event can take place with the participation of 25%. audience - the same rule applies in cinemas. A maximum of 100 people can participate in cultural events that take place outdoors - however, the number of viewers, listeners, visitors or participants must not exceed 1 person per 5 m 2 . " UPDATE: Ending of Policy: "Update 2021-07-19: On Monday (19 July), the FCDO summarised the recent easing of COVID-19 measures in public spaces: Outdoor and indoor gatherings and events are now allowed in Poland with up to 150 participants. Public transport is fully operational again, cultural facilities such as museums, theatres and cinemas are open, as are national parks, beaches and sports facilities. All shops are also open again. Masks are mandatory in enclosed public spaces and on public transport."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
August 23rd 2021

"Safety measures will be provided to schools and kindergartens, including gloves, masks and thermometers

We make every effort to ensure that the return of children and adolescents to school is safe . That is why MEiN together with RARS will transfer safety measures to schools and kindergartens. Disinfection stations with the function of measuring temperature in front of the building will be installed in schools. RARS will take care of the purchase and distribution of the equipment. In addition, all schools and kindergartens will receive personal protective equipment: gloves, masks, disinfectant liquid and thermometers. "
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Poland
November 2nd 2021
The government announced extensions on licenses due to COVID...
"The most important solutions:

    It will be possible to maintain the validity of seafarers' documents up to 90 days from the cancellation of an epidemic emergency or an epidemic.
    The co-financing of compensations for the provision of public collective transport services in passenger rail transport, commissioned by the organizers, will be extended until 31 December 2021. It will be financed from the state budget provided for honoring the statutory entitlement to discounted journeys by means of collective public transport.
    The validity of the river basin management plans and the flood risk management plans for the river basin districts will be extended by 12 months.
    They will be exempt from the obligation to pay fees for inland waterway vessels. These are ships that are used in business activities, consisting in the transport of cargo, passengers and the performance of technical works. This also applies to natural persons who navigate on waterways during the 2022 shipping season.
    The Minister of Infrastructure will take over the tasks in the field of water drainage in order to carry out a reform combating drought in agriculture."
date_end_spec: The policy is a one-time measure (e.g. publication of guidelines)
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Issuing of permits/certificates and/or processing of government documents
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
